newsitem.title: USA: NBA BASKETBALL-CINCINNATI'S FORTSON TO ENTER NBA DRAFT.
newsitem.headline: NBA BASKETBALL-CINCINNATI'S FORTSON TO ENTER NBA DRAFT.

text.p: University of Cincinnati junior forward Danny Fortson, Conference USA's Player of the Year the last two seasons, said Tuesday he will forego his senior year to enter the NBA draft.
The 6-foot-7 (2.01 m), 260-pound (118 kg) Fortson averaged 21.4 points and nine rebounds to lead the Bearcats in both categories this season.
"It was basically a business decision," said Fortson. "I just thought about my dream and my dream has always been to play in the NBA. I'm going with my heart."

Cincinnati, the preseason number one team in the country, had a disappointing season. The Bearcats (26-8) struggled against the nation's elite, with seven of their losses coming to NCAA Tournament teams. Cincinnati was eliminated in the second round of the NCAA Tournament by Iowa State.
Fortson had an inconsistent junior year, scoring 30 or more points on six occasions, but also had four games in which he scored less than 10 points.
